intro: Spermacoce echioides, commonly known as the roundleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant has small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy. It produces small, round, yellowish fruits that contain two seeds each. Spermacoce echioides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
